Based on my understanding, the "[Base]/Patient?birthdate=ge1988-11-01&_has:Encounter:patient:class=AAA&_has:Condition:patient:code=BBB" will look for patients whose birthdate is >= 1988-11-01 AND have at least one Encounter with class = AAA AND have at least one Condition with code = BBB. What if I wanted to request for those patients whose birthdate is >= 1988-11-01 AND (have at least one Encounter with class = AAA OR have at least one Condition with code = BBB)?
I have already read the documentation but I don't know how I should make such a request.

I think that would be 2 queries. Patient?birthdate=ge1988-11-01&_has:Encounter:patient:class=AAA + Patient?birthdate=ge1988-11-01&_has:Condition:patient:code=BBB and union (removing dups) on the client

Lee Surprenant said:

I think that would be 2 queries. Patient?birthdate=ge1988-11-01&_has:Encounter:patient:class=AAA + Patient?birthdate=ge1988-11-01&_has:Condition:patient:code=BBB and union (removing dups) on the client

How is that possible to send two queries and remove the duplicates for such intentions?
Mohsen Jafari has marked this topic as resolved.
